text: Nāṣiruddīn Maḥmūd Shāh (1435–1459) was the first Sultan of Bengal belonging to the restored Ilyas Shahi dynasty of Bengal sultanate. Formerly a farmer, he was selected as the next ruler of Bengal by the erstwhile nobility in 1435 CE, and ruled the country for over twenty years. During his peaceful reign, Bengal saw significant architectural development. == References == Category:Pages created with the Article Wizard from 2024 Category:15th-century births Category:1459 deaths Category:Indian monarchs Category:15th century in India
title: Mahmud Shah of Bengal
